In this calorie counter workshop, you'll practice how to validate user input, perform calculations based on that input, and dynamically update your interface to display the results.", + "You'll also practice basic regular expressions, template literals, the addEventListener() method, and more." + ] + }, "egkv": { "title": "213", "intro": [] }, "review-form-validation-with-javascript": { "title": "Form Validation with JavaScript Review",

@@ -0,0 +1,11 @@ +--- +title: Introduction to the Build a Calorie Counter +block: workshop-calorie-counter +superBlock: full-stack-developer +--- + +## Introduction to the Build a Calorie Counter + +Sometimes when you're coding a web application, you'll need to be able to accept input from a user. In this calorie counter project, you'll learn how to validate user input, perform calculations based on that input, and dynamically update your interface to display the results. + +In this practice project, you'll learn basic regular expressions, template literals, the addEventListener() method, and more."
